website_summaries.verdict: A top-selling canine calming chew with dog-approved flavors that has earned a loyal customer base for the natural ingredients and noticeable results.
pros: Combines organic plant-based ingredients, L-Theanine, and  L-Tryptophan to calm dogs' anxiety and related behaviors naturally
Available in turkey or peanut butter flavor
Some dog owners rave about how well the chews calm their pets' stress
cons: Mixed opinions on the flavor – some dogs love them, others refused to eat them
Like similar products, it won't reduce all dogs' anxiety levels

customer_reviews.title: Good treat but did not calm.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really work. But my dogs enjoyed eating them anyway. *UPDATE* The seller Online Wholesale Direct provides excellent customer service. Although I did not request a refund as I don't believe it was their fault, they reached out to me anyway to offer kind words and free products to try. Such unexpected and exceptional customer service is very hard to find nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic turned Believer
customer_reviews.text: Our rescue dog has serious anxieties. Four months of calm, quiet, and consistent routine has hardly made a dent in her fears. Example: after we moved a ten inch decorative pumpkin on the hearth she cowered and shook violently in a separate room for two days, refusing to eat or drink. She is still too afraid to explore the house. Walks are out of the question. In desperation (and with Halloween night approaching with lots of doorbell ringing) I purchased the calming bites. She was a different dog! She was playful, only barked one time at the doorbell, and didn't shake or cower once! Count me as a skeptic turned Believer!
customer_reviews.author: B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since my Loki began taking these Calming Bites, he has not been the same. Before, he would bite and scratch himself from being so anxious and now he seems like a normal dog again. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danny D.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations and then some
customer_reviews.text: Super anxious (separation anxiety and stranger anxiety) Pitt/Mastiff pup approved! Before these he would attempt to eat all the stuff as well as the house (pictures are stuff and hardwood floors he has chewed). As long as he gets his 3 a day he is a calm anxiety free pup! He loves to eat them and eagerly awaits his heart shaped treats. He was shedding BAD before these (I figured from stress/anxiety) and that’s not an issue anymore either!!
customer_reviews.author: Dobbins

customer_reviews.title: Did not work  for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product hoping it will work with fireworks fear, anxiety and hyperactive behavior. 2 out of my 3 dogs liked the product, but after a couple of days, one of them stopped eating the bites. (dont know why) The other one did like them but sadly it didnt work at all. (ate the whole jar, 2 bites per day according to her weight... never saw change) :-(
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: taking the edge off with anxiety related to separation, thunderstorms, and fireworks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these calming treats recently and I'm happy to recommend them as an option for taking the edge off with anxiety related to separation, thunderstorms, and fireworks. I was able to test all instances this past week. My dog wasn't drowsy, but he was definitely less anxious. These could be a good option for dogs on crate rest as well. He is a dachshund and he was given 1 treat and I noticed that he was not as rammy or unsettled about an hour later.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ottaviano

customer_reviews.title: Great stress reliever product
customer_reviews.text: Zesty Paws has been a tremendous help for our recently adopted, shy and fearful boy, Lloyd. He has other dog fears and noise sensitivity. Before ZP, walks were done with stealth and avoidance. One of these about half an hour before a walk and Lloyd is much more comfortable on his walks and more easily refocused when faced with stressful situations. We have been very pleased with the results bot the Zesty Paws products we've tried; the Calming Bites and the Salmon Oil.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our shepherd!
customer_reviews.text: These have made all the difference in our dog! We have a 75 lb. Shepherd mix who suffers from severe separation anxiety & had become extremely destructive to the point she hurt herself. This product is a life saver- it works well to help her stay calm and it is like she is a new dog! Our vet looked at the ingredients and said it is everything they would recommend and approves it. This also helps when storms blow through- she doesn't freak out like she used to. Thank you for such an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: BuckZoo2958

customer_reviews.title: This really does work
customer_reviews.text: I have written an early review on this product, because it was sent out too early for my dog. What I mean by that is that the Calming bites didn't have a chance to do their thing on her yet. So that Review was on what I new of the product at that point. NOW after being on them over a Month, I am so PLEASED with this product. It has helped my girl tremendously. I have already told several people about this product. Hope you try this on your pet too.
customer_reviews.author: BeagleDorm

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: Well I can’t give this item any higher rating. My dog got very ill with this stuff. He threw up several times . And yes he was calm but it was because he was so sick. We followed all instructions. Can not recommend this item , from a longtime dog owner , be careful
customer_reviews.author: William main

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Let’s just say this pic was taken during all the fireworks going off for the 4th of July right now! I honestly had low expectations for these, seeing as my 2 big babies are usually panicked messes during loud noises (fireworks, thunderstorms) - they would shake and tremble, pant and drool, pace and cry, destroy furniture ... you get the idea. Per their weight, they are each “allowed” 3 treats but 1-2 seems to do the trick! I’m so glad I got these, I used to feel so awful seeing them so scared but they really have calmed them down during times they’d normally be freaking out!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Minnich

customer_reviews.title: Give it time, it really works
customer_reviews.text: Give it some time before you review. At first I thought it wasn't working but I kept giving it to my Shar-pei who suffers from EXTREME anxiety. Like hide under the bed, bark at everyone, extreme. After about three weeks, I started noticing a difference in her. It's been a month now, and she's done a complete turn around. I'm not saying it will solve all your pups problems, but it makes such a difference, it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kitena Suttles

customer_reviews.title: Gas fumes. Allll day err day.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve given it to my dogs for two days and so far it hasn’t helped my 1 year old hound mix or my 18 month old corgi mix. It has filled my home with the horrific smell of my dogs gas. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Cg

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but my dog wouldn't eat it. Not even with peanut butter. I try everything I can think of. He don't like them. I cut the treats in 2, because they are a little big for a Chihuahua, but still he did not like them. Doesn't have afoul odor, but they don't smell appetizing either. I guess it's a gamble to by this product. UPDATE: I was contacted by a Customer Service Representative from Zenwise Health via E-mail and they gave me a refund relatively fast. I recommend to buy from this company. Now days not everyone stands behind their products. Thank you for making it right.
customer_reviews.author: TroyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Felt bad at first, but is very much needed haha =)
customer_reviews.text: At first I felt bad giving this to my little dog, but it was much needed. She hears any little sound and its a constant barking for several minutes, can drive you crazy. Kicks in after about 45 min to an hour. Most definitely works, does not change there personality at all, just is a bit more calm and relaxed. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Secret Shopper

customer_reviews.title: he has dramatically changed for the better. He is still tenative
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 year old lab mix that had become very fearful and aggressive with other dogs, even those he has grown up with. He was spending 99% of his time basically hiding on his bed, he wouldn't go outside if he had to walk past one of the other dogs and if one of them would get to close to him he would be very aggressive. Since we started giving him the Calming Bites, he has dramatically changed for the better. He is still tenative, but able to socialize and even play with our other dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Sutton

customer_reviews.title: 4 days at the Vet after taking this
customer_reviews.text: My dog got extremely sick after eating just one of the calming bites. She threw up and pooped all over the house. We had to bring her to the vet 4 days in a row because she would not eat and they couldn’t figure out what was wrong with her. $2500 in bills later they still didn’t know what caused the blood in her stool and refusal to eat for 4 days. I gave her one last night and now she is throwing up again and I realize after reading more reviews that this is the reason she got so sick and we truly thought we might lose her. These treats need to be recalled!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Saw no difference in my 1 year old GSD
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work for my 1 year old German Shepherd, but it didn't. I gave 2 to her everyday (she's 63 pounds) and saw no improvement in her energy and anxiety. We went to the vet and out to a baseball game on two of the days and she was still overly excited/ anxious. She doesn't have an aggression issue or anything, just high drive and anxious tendencies. I was hoping these would work to calm her down some on days when we can't go for walks, or just help her relax in new situations. I returned them. On the plus side, she has an extremely sensitive stomach and these didn't cause any issues for her.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Don't use medication use CALMING CHEWS !
customer_reviews.text: As much as I did not want to give her medication for anxiety this product has changed her life. She can now focus to learn new things and she is now relaxed and knows she is very loved. If you have a dog from a puppy mill or abuse I highly recommend this product ! It never changed who she is it just made it easier for her to realize everything is ok. I would never recommend a product that a animals could not have a happy life. She is doing great! THANK You for giving my baby the peace she deserves... Tracey J Rodgers
customer_reviews.author: Tracey J Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Worth Giving A Try!
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a rescued Great Dane in December of 2017. Loki came from a pretty rough past. He was abused and therefore very is stressed and distrustful, especially of my husband and can be easily frightened. So when I came across Calming Bites, I was impressed with your ingredients and favorable reviews. I wanted to give your product a try. Thus far we have noticed improvements, less growling, decreased frantic pacing, increased tail wagging. (Yay, we like that!) We plan to continue to use the Calming Bites in conjunction with training and of course just plain old love and patience. I expect things will only continue to improve and I believe Calming Bites has been positive contributing factor. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK! CAUSES RUNNY STOOL!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on our 8 lb, 11 year old Maltese who has anxiety issues. It did absolutely nothing to calm her, if anything it made her anxiety worsen. She also had runny stool that lasted the rest of the day. I tried it 3 separate days all with the same results. Unless you plan on letting your dog out to potty every ten minutes or cleaning up a runny, stinky mess.... don't order these. Sending them back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 containers of these to give them a more then fair trial while employing CC/DS. They made no difference in my dog's behavior. But they didn't upset his stomach and he ate them readily. He has been off these for a few months and doing CC/DS worked better then pills. I had hoped they would just take the edge of his anxiety but no change.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Calming chews 5: furbabies 0
customer_reviews.text: This is a WIN with the furbabies so far. It has rained, been hot, and bow its freezing (all that jn one week by rhe way... Welcome to Alabama lol) and my dogs are excited for theor night time treats and keep quiet all night. This is only a partial reprieve because the neighbors Rottys howl all night lol. Will definitely ne buying again!!
customer_reviews.author: ERica O.

customer_reviews.title: My dog loved these. So much so he figured out how ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved these. So much so he figured out how to open the plastic jar with screw cap and ate an entire containers worth. He was no less anxious after eating 45x the recommended dose. It gave him diarrhea, but he didn’t die, so that’s good. I can’t say these worked or not but at such a high dosage I would have expected some lethargy. Very expensive treats when consumed all at once. Dogs.
customer_reviews.author: kld311

customer_reviews.title: Finally my dog is not waking me at night!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has had trouble sleeping at night she is up looking out the windows for rabbits. Comes to wake me up to let her out 3-4 times a night. So on a neighbors recommendation I tried these calming bites. She’s a big girl, but I gave her one less than recommended. She has slept soundly for the past three days. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Red

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Based on such great reviews I was completely confident this product would help our stressed rescue puppy, but it was absolutely no match for Zeus. After months of training and structured routines he has come a long way but still has some anxiety issues we were hoping this would help him with. Although he loves these like crazy, I may as well be giving him candy for all the good it doesn't do. Unfortunately, you just can't know for sure until you try a product and I love this little guy enough to try anything to help him. Sadly, this turned out to be an expensive and disappointing fail.
customer_reviews.author: Kayce

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for our dog
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to give these a try, especially with all the good reviews I read. Unfortunately, these did not touch my dogs anxiety whatsoever. She is 40 lbs and I gave her the recommended dose of 2 chews and she was still a nervous nelly. I had high hopes with all the natural calming ingredients - even the melatonin! Oh well, she likes the taste so we will use as treats to finish the jar out.
customer_reviews.author: Shannie

customer_reviews.title: Won't eat them.
customer_reviews.text: My pug won't give these treats the time of day, and she will usually eat anything. I also bought the True Hemp brand, which she will eat, although she doesn't love. They seem to work okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a game changer for us! I take quite a few road trips with my dog, he often becomes anxious and refuses to get back in the car at rest stops. He’s a 100lbs and I have to literally lift him into the car!! Not these last few car rides! He’s is totally relaxed, hops in and out happily! The last test of these was a recent thunderstorm. He seemed almost unaffected by it and it usually causes him a huge amount of anxiety. He has been able to take beach trips, hikes in the Redwoods and trips to the lake with ease!
customer_reviews.author: W. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: I administered these to my dogs the first time I left them home alone in the new apartment. Upon my return I noticed that they were more aggressive towards one another and kept getting into fights. At one point my younger one even got aggressive with me. This is completely out of my dogs character and the only difference in the whole day were the "calming bites." I would hate to imagine what might have happened had I had a more aggressive breed. 24 hours later and my dogs are still not back to their old selves.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Wright

customer_reviews.title: Calming Bites Are A Necessity For Anxious Hounds
customer_reviews.text: I have four dogs, three of which do no respond well to fireworks or thunder storms. If I can anticipate a potental threat to their zen, I administer a dosage to negotiate their turmoil should fireworks start bursting or thunder start to rumble. I generally achieve favorable results by using this product and my dogs consume the bites without fuss. Of course my lab will eat anything. I crumble one up for my chihuahua and mix it with soft food to get him to take it. This product is good for daily use for dogs who don't like to be left home alone.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Michaels

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty sure dogs need to take these for awhile to ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure dogs need to take these for awhile to notice any benefits. I didn't exactly notice results right out of the gate, but after the first month now, I'm starting to notice a difference in my two mini aussies. One is very OCD and the other very ADD. They take the treats well every day even though I personally think the smell is less than desirable. So far, so good. Could it be better? I'm thinking so, but I also think it's still too early to completely judge this which is why it's at 4 stars right now. I'm encouraged at this point!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick...
customer_reviews.text: My rescue dog, a schnauzer mix, has separation anxiety, so I figured I would test this out on the weekend while I was at home with her. I only gave her one treat, and her poop turned liquid. It upset her intestines so badly that she had blood in her stool the next day. After a trip to the vet, she’s currently on the mend... I wish it was the miracle treat the five-star reviews rave about, but for now we’re just trying to get her tummy back to normal!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Calming Bites are definitely worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: This product has helped - I think, only been using it for a week - calm down a corgi who was becoming more and more aggressive to our other corgi. He has caused injury to the other dog on more than one occasion. Now he's listening and, though clearly frustrated, controls himself better. I haven't been giving him the Bites for very long but the Bites are the only thing different so I'm thinking they must be helping. Thank goodness because I was on the verge of asking the vet for anti-anxiety drugs for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Calming Treat for Anxious Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog is high energy and is not always the friendliest to strangers (we adopted her from a shelter.) This helps to calm her down without taking away her personality or drugging her up. I have only been giving her half doses even though her size determines she needs two. I give her one when we’re causing anxiety by running errands in and out of the house all day and two when we go out in unfamiliar social settings. You are not a bad dog owner by getting these. In fact, you may be helping your dog out! Worth a try. Works moderately well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nachos and Lemonheads on My Dad’s Boat

customer_reviews.title: Dog won't eat
customer_reviews.text: Upon giving the first one to my mini schnauzer, he would not eat it. It carried it around for a little while stopping to put it on the floor and smell it but wasn't tempted to eat it until I started to take it away. The second time I tried to give him one he took it to his crate where I found it several days later not realizing he hasn't eaten it. I plan to continue to try and get him to eat them but at this point I'm not optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: SED

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work for any of my dogs - if anything they made them even more anxious - one of my dogs started chewing clothing, which she had never done before, and she's not a puppy! I would steer clear of these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work on either of my nervous dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs. A 90# shepherd/hound mix, (*nothing* bothers him), a 20# shihtzu mix and a 55# goldendoodle. The shihtzu used to be calm, but as she’s aged (7 yrs old) she’s gotten “nervous” with noises and storms. Unfortunately, my goldendoodle (18 mos) follows her lead instead of the laid-back shepherd mix. We’re doing home renovation, so... power tools and air compressors. I’ve given both these nervous dogs 5-6 chews each, 2-3 hours prior to work starting. The chews haven’t helped either dog. ☹️ They don’t calm down at all. Sorry, no noticible difference in my household. They do like the flavor, so getting mine to eat them is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work, but willing to keep trying.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has thunderstorm/boom boom nightmare time fears. He is otherwise a 100% goodboy. We had another massive thunderstorm, and I gave him a chewy. I knew it would take awhile to see a result, but it didn't come. 4 hoursish later, I gave him another since the storm was still raging and he was having a rough time. Still nothing. Willing to keep trying, though.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a rescue dog and has always been a high stress and anxious dog. She is scared of many random items and is always on edge, rarely calming down! I gave her one of these calming bites the day we received it and she was a whole different dog! After about 20-30 minutes, she was calm and much more docile. We were setting up Christmas decorations and she was scared of the lights and ornaments, but after her taking the bites, she curled up on her blanket and just watched as we finished decorating, occasionally coming over for some love. I see such a change in her anxiety when we give her the calming bites.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Devey

customer_reviews.title: Zzz's like never before
customer_reviews.text: My sweet 18 year old dachshund is getting confused and restless in her old age. She was waking up in the middle of the night barking and ready to start the day and we were at a complete loss on what to do for her to sleep through the night... Until I found these life saving treats. Seriously, she eats these no problem and even reminds us of her nightly treat if we forget haha. She's not longer anxious at night and sleeps all through the night, waking up refreshed. Now we all get to sleep peacefully thanks to these treats!
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for my German Shepard at full dosage, I’ll try something else
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates it. I have to slather it in peanut butter and even then he spits it out after licking off the pb. I have given him one (crumbled into his food) and it has zero effect on him. Then I tried two. Nothing. He hates to smell it. He hates the taste. It has no effect. Im going to continue to give it to him bc I paid for it but I won’t purchase it again. Btw: my dog is a 1.5 years old, 50 lb, Xolo.
customer_reviews.author: Axel1973

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these! They calm her down.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really comment truthfully about the flavor of this product, but my 7-month-old German Shepherd Dog seems to love it. She gets one of these treats every night at bedtime to help her sleep the whole night through. Plus, she's a hyper dog and easily excitable. When she gets beyond my control, I give her a Calming Bite and she settles down within 1/2 hour or so. I love this product and have recommended it to dog owner friends. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Melanson - Animal Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Watery Stool
customer_reviews.text: Arrived sufficiently packaged and in a timely manner. The Soft chews just didn't go with my dog. I gave him 2 in the morning and about 3 hours later he had an upset tummy. So I stopped for 3 day and gave him just 1 and about 3 hours later he had the upset tummy again. He is a 83lb Dobe and isn't really sensitive. I got the Turkey flavor when it was on Lightning Deal. I guess it was a good deal and he liked them but I am Definitely not using it anymore. Ugh...$21 in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaGulia

customer_reviews.title: Anxious no more.
customer_reviews.text: My two older dogs have developed a great fear of thunderstorms which is a bit tough on them since we live in Florida and have wicked storms almost daily in the summertime. Over the years I’ve tried dozens of different calming techniques—thundershirts, homemade melatonin treats, CBD, and lots of other different OTC remedies. Most worked a bit but there was still major anxiety. We were one step away from getting doggie Xanax which I really didn’t want to start with serious prescribed medication. Once I found this Zesty Paws product we have stuck with it for almost 3 years. It also works great for long car rides and hurricanes.
customer_reviews.author: Em Dechert-boscovich

customer_reviews.title: Calms anxiety but may affect eating habits!
customer_reviews.text: My Yorky mix dog is very hyper; so I was hoping that this product would be perfect to calm her anxiety. After using it for 2-3 days, my dog was definitely calmer but it affected her appetite completely!! She didn't want to eat at all! I even tried reducing the dose to half a bite and giving it every other day. However, it still affected her eating habits. I admit she would go to sleep early and not stay up playing. I suggest any dog owner to watch for strange changes in behavior when using this product. I stopped giving it to my dog and she still had problems with her appetite weeks afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Seda Miro

customer_reviews.title: Helps my elderly dog
customer_reviews.text: Our female miniature schnauzer, Ivy, is fifteen years old and has been showing signs of dementia in the last few months. She becomes confused, demanding, and restless in the early evenings, barking and staring at us for no apparent reason (some people think old dogs behave like this after sundown because their vision isn’t as good). We have found it helps to give her a second dinner around 8:30 pm, but the best treatment has been a few of the Zesty Paws Calming Bites when she starts to get stressed and anxious. They have a strong odor and must be delicious because she is always excited to get them! Within 30-45 minutes, she settles down and relaxes nicely until bedtime.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Berg

customer_reviews.title: My dog is now a much calmer canine
customer_reviews.text: My dog suffers from anxiety in both social settings and due to separation anxiety. This supplement has been a big help. She’s more relaxed on walks and more confident. She no longer trembles with anxiety. This has been even more helpful than the thunder shirt. I highly recommend it. My dog is a 10 yr old pit mix and she’s 60 lbs. she takes 2 chews a day. She is also a VERY picky eater but she eats these with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kimani

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I don't totally dislike your product BUT...I doesn't work with my 1 1/2 year old doxy who gets overly excited when guest arrive. In fact the last four times a gave it it her she actually became more energetic, it seems to have the opposite effect This is not the response it wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps anxious behavior but dog hates the taste
customer_reviews.text: Works wonders for my anxious rescue dog. I have noticed some behavior changes since I put him on this for about a month. He no longer chews things up when I leave and generally seems more calm. He hates eating them though. If I wrap it in something he will spit it out. So the process of giving him his medicine takes awhile but it works! Wish they had a more potent bacon flavor or something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good treat
customer_reviews.text: Oh, how funny. Did anyone actually try these so they could comment on the taste? Anyway, my GSP seems to live them so they must be alright. Only giving 4 stars because they don’t do much to calm my 3 year old GSP. With that being said, it’s hard to say what “calm” is for my dog. She’s like 10 espressos in at normal speed. They would probably have a better effect on dogs with a more normal energy level.
customer_reviews.author: timothy d.

customer_reviews.title: A miracle product
customer_reviews.text: Apparently my dog was anxious I bought this to help with pain. I give it to my dog before bed. In the mornings no pee or poop in the house! I had no idea he was anxious. I am absolutely thrilled with this product! Highly recommend and definitely will be buying again. Not only isn't there any pee or poop to clean up in the morning but I am so happy to know my baby is no longer anxious at night. He deserves peace. I wish I had known about this product years ago. Thank you Zesty Paws!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Williams

customer_reviews.title: After a week, the pup refused to eat them
customer_reviews.text: My dog has separation anxiety and this year it has increased to a fairly unbearable level. I bought these treats as a part of treatment to help get back to a baseline. He started off interested in the treats. Gobbled them up. after a few days, I had to talk him into them, now he just won't eat them at all. I think they upset his stomach enough that he was unwilling to try them again. Never got to a point where it helped with the anxiety, but that may be purely because we didn't use them long enough for it to take effect.
customer_reviews.author: Stina P

customer_reviews.title: Stress case
customer_reviews.text: My German was damaged goods, set to be euthanized by the shelter, we gave her a chance... a year later she's still very skiddish, always looking for the next threat, always alert, without these calming bites she gives herself so much anxiety she regularly vomits, so she's pretty dependant on these. They do exactly what they claim.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Corley

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs love this product!  Can I give it more than 5 stars?
customer_reviews.text: We have two small house dogs. One is about 5 years old and the older dog is 12. Her name is Daisy. She had slowed down and didn’t seem as peppy. We started giving both dogs this product at the beginning of the year and we are delighted with the results. While Daisy isnt like she was a puppy, she is much more frisky. She sometimes even running through the house! She is jumping up on things (couch, bed, etc) better. Our 5 year old, Jessie, seems calmer. The dogs love the taste. They get excited anytime they see us near the orange container. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful! I'm very happy with the way my German Shepherd has responded to it. He would get very anxious when my son's dog would come over and extremely territorial. Ever since we've been giving him this product, he can actually be in the same room as my son's dog and stay very calm. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for our dog
customer_reviews.text: We thought we would try this as a natural alternative to the pills our vet prescribed our dog for her separation anxiety. The first time we gave them to her, we saw no change in her behavior--she was definitely not calmed after taking the chews. The next time we gave them to her they seemed to have the opposite effect--she was MORE hyper and excited. We tried one more time, left a camera on her and waiting two hours before leaving the house. She barked the entire time we were gone--non stop--as if she were more agitated. I am sure these work for some dogs, but our dog is unique!
customer_reviews.author: H. Wheales

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I started a bunch of calming items (supplements, pheremones, wraps) for my dog all at once, so it's difficult to say which are making the biggest difference, but this is one of them. My dog is happy to eat these calming bites, and I give him one 15-30 minutes before I have to leave. Maybe it's my imagination, but he seems more chill than before, and he has been making less noise (barking/howling) while I'm gone since I started giving him these chews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seeing some improvement
customer_reviews.text: Our dog, Larry, is very dog reactive. When we first got him, he would completely melt down anytime he saw another dog (or cat, or squirrel, etc). He has been using these treats for a few weeks now. While he hasn't made a complete transformation, it's become much easier to calm and refocus him. His freak outs are definitely not as gigantic as they once were. Although we do still have the occasional epic dog explosion, we are starting to see a more mellow boy. The treats are a little stinky, but Larry loves them. Leaving four stars for now, but may come back and up it to five if we continue to see improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not calm my dog (Melatonin bites)
customer_reviews.text: Does not calm my dog. I didn't notice a difference in his behavior. I still give him some as a treat because he likes the taste (just to get rid of them so it's not a total wasted purchase), but I won't be buying these again for the purpose of attempting to calm him. Maybe he is just too high strung, i'm not entirely sure. That's not to say that this company is bad. I've bought other products from this company and they make great products. I will continue to buy other products from them, just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: MuchosPoptartos

customer_reviews.title: Like A Different Dog
customer_reviews.text: Our small dog loves her treats! She gets 1/2 in the morning, & 1/2 at night daily for about 3 months now. We saw a big difference in her after the 1st day (CRAZY!), & she continues to improve! No more shaking at all after the first week. She used to shake a lot, even when sleeping, & bark more at walkers outside. She’s much happier, & our 4 kids are able to enjoy her more! These pics represent before & after times when she would normally be almost unmanageably anxious, such as in the car or at the vet. You can tell her disposition has changed!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: These are great! My dogs chomped them right up and we’re ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My dogs chomped them right up and we’re totally mellows out. Used with a German Shepherd, a chihuahua and a daschund mix. I tried them the day the arrived, and my dogs laid down and took a nap and were chilled out the rest of the day. A week later, I used the treats again and took all 3 dogs in the cabin on the airplane. No aggression, whining, orb barking in the airport or on the plane. They’re about the size of a thick Starburst candy.
customer_reviews.author: Usn Kac

customer_reviews.title: Calms my high strung Boxer right down......
customer_reviews.text: These work so well on my high strung Boxer. She is extremely high strung and just one of these calms her down so she can focus on learning her lessons and most importantly not move the furniture around in the house :) She thinks that they are treats, and I am so glad that are Turkey and not chicken, because she is allergic to chicken. Thank you Zesty Paws!
customer_reviews.author: PrecioustoHim

customer_reviews.title: Chilled Fido!
customer_reviews.text: We love this product! It works as advertised, my usually high strung, barks at everything dog is transformed into a calm, relaxed happy dog after a dose of this supplement and about 30 minutes. The good part is he's still up for a walk, play or whatever! He's not drowsy, just relaxed.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Better than CBD for dogs
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. My dog is hyper in the car, back and forth, window to window. Started giving him one in the morning. Noticed how his demeanor is more calm and relaxed. Lays down on seat and casually looks out window once in a while. No pacing. I missed a day, took him in the car and he was right back to old behavior. These chews are amazing. He gets frantic when left alone to the point of chewing woodwork, couches, etc. I haven’t tried leaving him alone yet but when I do, I’ll give an update. BTW...can’t put him in a crate, he chews thru.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Not for our dog
customer_reviews.text: Very sad the product did not help our dog during storms and fireworks. During 4th of July Chula was very anxious, panting heavily and shaking despite taking a dose. After three hours, I tried to give her another dose but she refused to eat them. She didn't like the flavor since the very beginning. I only gave her the chewables three times and decided to return them as they were not doing any benefit to Chula. Good price for the amount of chewables but not the right formula for our pet. Very glad I received my refund. P.S. I tried to post a video of her shaking during 4th of July but the app was not working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Best cure for anxiety prone rescue dog!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many high dollar anxiety treatments but nothing has worked for my 9-year-old Catahoula mix.....UNTIL NOW! Thanks to these treats, my dog no longer experiences the excessive barking or severe shaking she used to. Events like thunderstorms, vet trips, and fireworks are now much easier to endure! I am also surprised at her delight in eating them. After reading the reviews I was skeptical that she would not eat them alone but thank fully she loves the turkey flavor! Thank you for creating an affordable yet effective calming treat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BY FAR THE BEST!!
customer_reviews.text: Best product I've come across for my pups. We travel a lot & my 10mth old pup gets nervous during car rides as she's had many emergency animal hospital visits so she associates the car with going back to be "hurt" again. Administering the bites to the dogs about 30min before getting in the car allowed both dogs to relax on the youngest pups 1st 8hr roadtrip. I've tested the bites on the puppy as well with the bites for when there's company in the yard, work being done on the house and when there have been fireworks and she was not affected.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus3

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY NO HELP AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: I did exactly what the directions said: Give 1/2 dose for a few days, then full dose. Gave both of my dogs 1/2 for two days and then gave them each a whole dose on the Fourth of July. May as well given them a piece of kibble as it didn't help one bit. So sorry to say this. Was hoping to rave! We're desperate to help them. Now, it was the Fourth, but that's why I got it. And it's advertised for help with fireworks. Also, my dogs eat anything...and they weren't crazy about the taste or smell (I didn't like the smell either). They're gobblers, but this...they pulled back. Had to disguise it with food.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: These treats saved my house from total destruction. I have a rescue German Shepherd mix who got very anxious whenever we left the house. Crating didn’t work as he broke his metal heavy duty kennel. We tried these and saw results quickly! The first couple times he still had “accidents” but no more broken shoes/books/remotes. Gave him 3 treats each time we left for a couple months & happy to say he doesn’t need them anymore. He still has occasional “accidents” but minor and less frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Liz L

customer_reviews.title: My dog are beyond skittish and won’t even consider this treat to help them.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I paid almost $30 for this and it might as well be trash to me. Not sure why I didn’t return it except that I was very sick during that time. My dog won’t even consider eating this. I’ve covered it with wet dog food, peanut butter, tuna but nothing seems to convince either dog to eat it. They were just adopted from a humane society after being there for a year. They are so skittish that they will only approach me when I give them the treats they were fed at HS - turkey roll cut up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I don't think they are having too much effect.... my pit, Copper, has horrible anxiety and is scared to death of people, car rides, essentially everything. We will keep trying to give him chews and experiment with timing for outings. I'll update his progress if any changes occur.
customer_reviews.author: livebyfaith

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately did not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try this product due to the positive reviews; my dog has had separation anxiety her whole life but with COVID it’s gotten much worse, I can’t go into another room without her following me or whining. I don’t want to try something like prescriptions due to side effects so I thought I’d try these; she hates them. I have to disguise them for her to eat them, and the couple of times she actually ate them I notice that she isn’t any better when it comes to the things that make her anxious. Hoped for this to work, especially for the price :/
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Sanity saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried EVERYTHING under the sun for my dog. She is terrorized by loud noises. Fireworks, roofers, thunder, hail, loud rain, etc. I decided to try these out for July 4th and it has been amazing. Usually she runs around the house crying and whimpering in fear. She gets so stressed her hair starts coming out in clumps. This year we started giving her these 2 days before to make sure they wouldn’t make her sick. She LOVES them and she is calm. She is alert and knows there are fireworks but she isn’t pacing, crying, or loosing hair. I will be buying these again and recommending to everyone I know!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Jones

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Our pup gets very hyper and crazy when we have guests. He also can be very bold at times and LOVES to steal things when he's in his crazy moods. These have been wonderful. They keep him calm when we have people over or when he is just acting crazy. I personally don't love the smell but he loves them so that's good enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: c.rea.97.85

customer_reviews.title: Helps with constant pacing
customer_reviews.text: I have an Australian Shepherd who is 2 years old. She s always had anxiety since she was a puppy. We run her and tire her with fetch, but she still paces. The calming bites help her settle more easily and actually lay down and rest while she's not in her crate. It's not going to cure your dog of anxiety, but it will help reduce the amount of anxiety and anxious habits that they have.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Buy buy buy, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Our German shep puppy loves these. We decided to try calming treats because our puppy would totally freak out whenever in the crate and nothing we did help ease him. The first night we gave these to him he wasnt a fan of the crate but it was so much better then previous nights with out the calming treats and slept longer then 20 minutes at a time. Which was amazing. We have given one to our puppy every night since. Smell like crap to us but my dog loves them. So thankful for these.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Producr is hit or miss it seems
customer_reviews.text: I didnt expect a miracle but with all the great reviews i hoped my skittish dog would have a little anxiety relief. I started off with recommended dose of 2 treats a day for a week with zero signs of improvement. The directions say you can safely double the dose so thats what i did. After two more weeks i dont see even a subtle change in his behavior. He may even be slightly worse. I understand that natural supplements may work for some and not others so i hesitate to say this product isnt worth trying but for me its not worth investing in a 2nd tub.
customer_reviews.author: CJ_widmar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Anxious Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Long history with my dog having high anxiety and being skittish. Bought these hoping it would help him to relax and calm him down when he is anxious. Calming Bites worked wonders! The first day I gave them to my husky he was far more relaxed and did not run and hide when nervous like normal. Was able to give them to him as a "treat" and he seems to like the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Beccah

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to tell how much these really helped but I so think they did something. One of my dogs was having a hard time adjusting to the new puppy and was showing some aggression and we were freshly moved into a new house as well. I used these in combination with L theanine supplements and a basket muzzle and gradually over time things became less tense and now my dog is muzzle free, toys are able to be on the floor, and we have minimal stress!
customer_reviews.author: Bmallen14

customer_reviews.title: like he's afraid of the noise your cellphone makes and ...
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews and people were raving about these bites. Saying how their insane dog was able to relax, my pooch is just a little weird, like he's afraid of the noise your cellphone makes and he's very aware of shadows, but doesn't really understand them so he's hesitant. Any loud bang, he nearly jumps out of his spots and I didn't notice any different after giving the recommended dose for his weight, which was two treats a day! He loved them, but today we finished the tub and I wasn't very thrilled other than he liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Llisa

customer_reviews.title: Thunderstorm miracle
customer_reviews.text: We've tried the thundershirt, benedryl, sileo, gabapentin/trazadone combo, and the Bach Rescue Remedy. NONE of those help my scaredy-cat pitbull calm down during storms until this. At the first clap of thunder, he would shake, pace, try to get behind furniture, pant, and just have a full out panic attack. We give him 3 of these if we know a storm is gonna start in an hour and have sometimes missed the pre-dose and give them as soon as we hear a rumble, and these still work amazingly. No more pacing. He still shakes a bit, but he just lays down.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey K.

customer_reviews.title: My border collie wouldn't touch them :(
customer_reviews.text: I don't really know if the quality of these calming treats is good or not. Many reviews are so very positive and I wanted to give a positive review too. My border collie looked at me as if I was out of my head when I tried to give her one. On the up side if you have a picky dog that is willing to be tricked, these are easily crumbed into food or peanut butter. However, my girl was never convinced! Money down the drain for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Calms dogs to enable grooming
customer_reviews.text: Our standard poodle is impossible to groom in her foot areas and face. With Calming Bites one can easily trim her toes, foot pad areas and face over an extended period of time. I shared a couple of bites with my neighbor who was experiencing issues with her small dog and the feedback was excellent - they worked for her and she is now ordering this product.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: My boston terrier has terrible anxiety! He has not only destroyed 3 kennels, he has also destroyed multiple dog beds! I ordered everything that said anything on it for calming down dogs! After spending large amounts of money on things that didn't work for him i came across these calming chews! This Product Actually Works! Now I Can Come Home To A Calm Dog And Nothing Destroyed! He Also Loves The Flavor Which Is Amazing Sense He's A Very Picky Dog!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Great for seniors
customer_reviews.text: So our pup is deep into his Golden years & while he’s on medication & receiving acupuncture he still was having anxiety issues. So he’s been getting Calming Bites for a few weeks now. It’s been a very positive experience & I highly recommend them. Our boy is settling easier & sleeping more soundly. Only minor issue is the taste. I was hoping to give it as a treat but crumble it in his food instead. No biggie at all. Thanks Calming Bites for helping our boy chill out in his senior years.
customer_reviews.author: heidi

customer_reviews.title: MY DOG HALLUCINATED ON THESE CHEWS
customer_reviews.text: I have an 85 lb. Golden retriever. Gave her the recommended dose of 3 chews before our 8 hr. car ride, and she was more anxious than I've ever seen her. She was biting and growling at every semi truck that went by us!l (lol pretty funny though). I've seen good reviews about this stuff for the most part so I'm assuming it has been affective for some families, but we saw the opposite affect on our girl. She panted a lot more, went into several trances, and I'm pretty sure she was hallucinating a little. Maybe I worry too much or maybe it was just an adverse reaction . Either way, this product is just not for use
customer_reviews.author: Katy v.

customer_reviews.title: No effect on my dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog (beagle and English bulldog mix) wasn't helped by these at all. He weighs about 65 lbs, so we gave him 2 chews the first time there was a thunderstorm. Nothing. 3 chews the next time. Nothing. 4 chews the next two times. Nothing. Nothing. We also had to wrap them in lunch meat because otherwise he wouldn't even eat them because they smell (and I imagine, taste) bad. We might try them again, just because we have them. But they haven't worked at all in calming our dog during thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: A staple supplement
customer_reviews.text: As my dog has gotten older, he can get very restless and sometimes aggressive toward our other dog at night. He's always been high anxiety but this is a newer development. We've repurchased this 9 times (6 without melatonin and 3 with). We will keep purchasing the melatonin kind as long as he's around. They help him (and us) sleep through the night. We give them to him a couple of hours before bed as they seem to take a couple of hours to start to work. They're also great for thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: Tere

customer_reviews.title: Horrible diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My dog tends towards anxiety, but not so much that she requires prescription medication so I decided to try these. After a few days on half the suggested does, she developed severe diarrhea. We put her on a chicken and rice diet and nothing else. Between that and meds from the vet, she quickly improved and we transitioned her back to her normal diet. Today I gave her a half dose of a Bite and she was right back to diarrhea. The rest (almost a full jar!) will be going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: My puppy didn’t enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for our road trip over the holiday weekend. Our puppy didn’t really care for the taste of these calming bites. She was very resistant to eating them and after some coaxing to eat it, we didn’t notice much of a change in her behavior. I was hoping this would help relax her when she gets a bit fired up, but this didn’t work for us. She loves the mobility bites, but just not a fan of these calming bites. I hope others have better luck with this!
customer_reviews.author: NL022

customer_reviews.title: Works ok. dogs didn't care much for it though
customer_reviews.text: It worked okay. Dogs didn't really care for the taste. But then again they are picky eaters. This hemp oil works better but the dogs hate me putting this in their mouth. I do it anyway because it definitely calms them down.
customer_reviews.author: LolaW

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for larger dogs
customer_reviews.text: I personally couldn't tell you how well they taste, but my dog is sometimes hesitant to eat them and she's not very picky except for vegetables. She does gobble them down after 2 seconds. I haven't noticed too much of a difference I've been using them for 2 months my dog is undergoing heartworm treatment and I wanted to try and keep her calm as much as possible naturally. She used to have more panic attacks which she doesn't but for the price and I go through one of the month I'm not sure maybe it would be for smaller dogs Stella needs three to four a day:/ love the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Calm zen
customer_reviews.text: Freya is afraid of noises, especially motor and booming noises. Before using Zesty Paws chews, we had to carry or coax her outside to go on a potty / pleasure walk. Since using the Chews, (1 twice a day) Freya likes going out for a walk and rarely gets frightened enough to shutdown like she used to do. I am very pleased with her response to this supplement. It is as good as I could expect without being a pharmaceutical requiring a Vet's prescription.
customer_reviews.author: VT/NH

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for me. Absolutely no difference in dog. (16 lb Jack Russel/Beagle mix)
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work for my dog. He just reacts to it like any other treat, and doesn't calm down afterwards. Tried giving it to him when he had the zoomies. He just ate it and kept zooming. Gave it to him 15 minutes before a garbage truck came by. He still had a major freakout. It does nothing for separation anxiety, either. Update: Zenwise got in touch and offered a refund or replacement item, saying they had a 100% satisfaction guarantee. Also, I found that the Thundervest did work amazingly for my dog although the treats didn't, so if these don't work for you, that is an option.
customer_reviews.author: Hb

customer_reviews.title: Buy these bites!  They work!
customer_reviews.text: I’m guessing these taste great because my doodles gobble them up and they usually inspect stuff that they are given as if someone was trying to snuff them out! Our pups are litter mates and can play rough. Bodhi is 60lbs and I give him 2...he’s chill in about 20 min or so. Ashley is 40lbs and we give her one...she’s chilled out in about the same time! We will definitely keep a healthy supply of these bites!
customer_reviews.author: C Conley

customer_reviews.title: She is doing so much better since we started the calming chews
customer_reviews.text: My puppy has severe anxiety with storms and has been very nervous every time it rains now. She is doing so much better since we started the calming chews. I have even given them to her if we are going for a walk because she tends to get nervous around other bigger dogs. These chews have made a world of difference and I am so glad to have found them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: These Work!
customer_reviews.text: We have three dogs, two Pits and a Basset, that don't like fireworks. We live in a neighborhood that loves to celebrate every holiday with fireworks. These chews are the best we have found to help our dogs get through those times. Now they barely notice the booms! When an extra loud one goes off, they are back to normal in a few seconds instead of hours later. The best thing is that these chews don't affect our dogs behavior except to help calm them! These really do work!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Helps with “growly sky monsters”
customer_reviews.text: I have two Jack Russell’s - 12 & 8. Both are terrified of thunder and these definitely take it down a couple of notches if I can get one into them BEFORE the storm starts! I have to break them in half, and often, leave it by their bed and they will eat it after a couple of minutes. My older dog now has “smoldering pancreatitis” and this contributed to some “doggy dementia” that started manifesting itself in the evenings (Sundowners Syndrome, my vet said). These have made a tremendous difference in her anxiety level!! I give her one every morning and she’s SO much more peaceful all day and through the evening. For us, they work.
customer_reviews.author: W.E.

product_meta.title: Zesty Paws Calming Bites for Dogs - Anxiety Composure Relief with Suntheanine - for Dog Stress & Separation Aid in Fireworks, Thunder + Chewing & Barking
feature_bullets: A natural formula for anxiety – Zesty Paws Calming Bites are turkey flavored chewable supplements with natural and organic ingredients that help dogs with nervous, anxious, or aggressive behaviors feel calm and comfortable.

Features Suntheanine – These calming treats contain 30mg of Suntheanine per chew, which is a pure and GRAS-designated form of L-Theanine that helps stimulate brain waves to promote relaxation with no drowsy effect.

Helps with hyperactive & aggressive behavior – Each chew contains Thiamine and Organic Chamomile, which act as a relaxer that can help reduce jumping, biting, and barking from dogs that display aggressive or hyper active tendencies.
Soothes anxieties – This Calming Bites supplement may encourage natural anti-anxiety relief for a thunderstorm, fireworks, car rides, or separation anxiety.

Advanced complex of proven ingredients – These treats contain Organic Ginger Root, L-Tryptophan, and Organic Passion Flower to help minimize outbursts, while Valerian Root reduces scratching, restlessness, paw licking, and chewing.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
